intro: Trichodypsis mocquerysiana, commonly known as the Cape mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, rocky environments. Trichodypsis mocquerysiana is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
